DataElement.preferredDefinition: A human offspring (son or daughter) of any age; an immediate progeny._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._(an-es-THET-iks) Substances that cause loss of feeling or awareness. Local anesthetics cause loss of feeling in a part of the body. General anesthetics put the person to sleep._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. ReferenceDocuments.name: If sedation is needed, how of
ReferenceDocuments.description: If sedation is needed, how often do you provide oral sedation only to child patients in your practice, whether or not they have special needs?
